We are looking for a Senior Django Backend Engineer to join our Greek branch in Koukaki, Athens.

  • Love for music.

This role also works closely with the Accounting Manager to support monthly, quarterly, half year, and year-end financial close and the preparation of financial reports as requested by management.

Duties/Responsibilities:

  • Manage all activities in the accounts payable function including the invoice approval process, timely payment of vendor invoices, and accurate posting of transactions from the bank feed and credit cards.
  • Maintain accurate records over the general ledger including monthly bank, credit card and account reconciliations to identify and correct any errors.
  • Process payroll and invoices in HRIS for all employees and contractors.
  • Assist in the onboarding of new employees and contractors.
  • Compile, analyze and report financial information to management and government agencies.
  • Develop, implement and maintain systems, policies, and procedures within the accounts payable function to ensure adherence to company guidelines, department budgets, and internal controls.
  • Provide accounting assistance to project managers and operations staff; respond to financial questions/concerns to meet business needs.
  • Support timely monthly, quarterly, half-year, and year-end financial close and preparation of financial statements, including journal entries, account reconciliations, accruals, and overall maintenance of all operational management accounts.
  • Prepare financial reports as requested by management by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing account information and trends primarily within Accounts Payable.
  • Maintain vendor records and perform 1099 filings on an annual basis.
  • Develop processes to increase efficiency and accuracy.
  • Assist with audits and tax returns.
  • Perform other duties and responsibilities, as assigned.
requirements:

  • CPA is preferred.
  • In-depth understanding of GAAP, financial reporting, corporate finance principles and accounts payable procedures.
  • Experience with QuickBooks, Sage Intacct, Expensify, and Adaptive Planning or similar systems.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills; extremely detail-oriented.
  • Commitment to ethical behavior.
  • Excellent time management skills with a proven ability to meet deadlines.
  • Strong analytical, multitasking, and problem-solving skills.
  • Ability to analyze information and processes.
  • Ability to function well in a high-paced and at times stressful environment.
  • Stay up to date with guidelines set by Orfium, the clients and industry partners.
  • Experience in the entertainment industry with knowledge of accounting for royalties is a plus.
  • Knowledge of computer programming languages (i.e. Python, VBA) also a plus.

This position does not supervise.

title: Product Manager
description:
A few things about Orfium

In Orfium we are building the digital future of the Music and Media Industry, by providing complete solutions to generate and manage revenue, promote content, and provide business insights.

YouTube, Spotify, Apple, Netflix, and various other platforms have changed the experience of the audience. On our part, we are building the technology to find content on digital platforms, recognize it, and match it with the catalogs of the owners. We are developing solutions based on Big Data, Machine Learning, and Business Intelligence to provide Enterprise services and complete SaaS solutions.

Orfium currently serves some of the biggest clients in Entertainment, as the leading Copyrights Management and Information Technology company. With our HQ in Malibu, CA, and our R&D department in Athens, Greece, we are able to serve the biggest markets while we innovate fast.

If you believe you can make a difference by joining one of the fastest-growing tech companies in the world, you should definitely apply!


WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR

A skillful and passionate Product Manager that will manage one of our main B2B products for delivering value on YouTube. That means that we need a good understanding of the enterprise software, a data-driven mindset, and the management of a product lifecycle.

The ideal candidate will have a startup mindset along with analytical thinking skills and will be willing to take initiatives and execute the product strategy effectively and report back with ideas that will improve our Product Suite and Operations.


WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING

You will be a part of a Design-driven, Agile Product Team and will:

  • Drive a multi-disciplinary team of engineers to solve big problems in the music industry with Big Data and AI characteristics.
  • Analyze business requirements and prioritize tickets for the relevant teams
  • Monitor the performance of products
  • Collaborate with the Product Management and Design Team to build a Product Roadmap.
  • Collaborate with Tech Leaders in order to achieve deadlines and deliver products efficiently
  • Align with the Operations department in order to locate any possible issues and deficiencies for B2B products
  • Design and run experiments
  • Explore opportunities for new products, new business models and prepare the roadmap for new versions of existing products
requirements:
NEEDED SKILLS

  • Proven experience as a product manager or product owner
  • Proven knowledge of Agile methodologies
  • Passion for innovation and impact
  • Good design perception
  • Strong written and verbal Greek and English communication skills

EXTRA POINTS:

  • Love for music!
  • Agile certifications
  • An academic background in computer science, or proven programming skills
  • Previous experience in a startup company
  • Familiarity with Programming Languages and Frameworks (Python, Django framework, React Framework, and more)
  • Experience in Big Data, Analytics or Payment projects or products
  • MBA or Master in Business
